author: TNN
title: Rhino Calf: Rhino calf rescued in Kaziranga National Park | Guwahati News - Times of India
text: Guwahati: A two-year-old female rhino calf which was separated from its mother was rescued from the floodwaters inside the Kaziranga National Parkâ€™s Kohora range on Wednesday evening.According to teams of the Assam forest line and mobile veterinary service from the Centre for Wildlife Rehabilitation and Conservation (CWRC), managed by the Assam forest department and the Wildlife Trust of India, the calf was found struggling to stay afloat inside the park.After its rescue, the calf was transported to the CWRC and is currently being monitored 24X7 by a team of veterinarians and animal keepers, officials added.We also published the following articles recentlySeparated from mother, 2-year-old rhino calf rescued from flood in Assam's Kaziranga national parkLearn about the successful rescue of a 2-year-old female rhino calf from floodwaters in Kaziranga National Park. The calf, separated from its mother, is now receiving round-the-clock care at the Centre for Wildlife Rehabilitation and Conservation. Follow the journey of this calf as it prepares to return to the wild.111494892Assam floods: 17 wild animals drown, 72 rescued in Kaziranga National ParkLearn about the recent flooding in Kaziranga National Park where 17 wild animals tragically drowned. Forest authorities rescued 72 animals, with 32 under treatment. The flood situation remains severe in Kaziranga, affecting 173 forest camps. Assam is also grappling with flooding, impacting over 16.25 lakh people in 29 districts.111477144Four animals dead in flooded Kaziranga National Park, 24 rescuedLearn about the recent flooding in Kaziranga National Park where four hog deer drowned and 24 animals were rescued. Find out how the flood waters are impacting the park's ecosystem and why experts believe floods are essential for its preservation.111433788
